intro: Adonis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered adonis, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
